While Linux monitoring data is captured, the Performance Toolkit’s minidisk space can fill up quickly. 396 Virtualization Cookbook: Vol 1: IBM z/VM 7.2 Viewing performance data from the Linux kernel in the Performance Toolkit After the system has time to collect data, you can use the Performance Toolkit to view Linux performance data. To view that data, drill down into menu 29, Linux systems. Use either the browser interface or the 3270 interface, as shown in Figure 12-7.
